result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Schweitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John R Schweitzer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John R Schweitzer was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Pay costs of action and costs of probation.

Attend, pay for and successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program or Anger Management program or both at direction of agent.

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations of counselor.

 Must submit to psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations of counselor.

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Def is to sign up for probation today.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

15CM107 & 15CM157. Defendant John R. Schweitzer in custody and in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached resolution in these matters. Plea questionnaire presented. Colloquy. NC pleas for Ct 1 in 15CM107 and Ct 1 in 15CM157. Court finds factual basis and accepts NC pleas, finds def guilty on 2 charges. Comment on sentencing. 

15CM107  Ct 1: Sentence withheld for 24 months probation, concurrent. Conditions: Pay costs of action and costs of probation, Attend, pay for and successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program or Anger mgt program or both at direction of agent , AODA assessment and follow through, with recommendations of counselor,  must submit to psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations of counselor, DNA sample and surcharge. Def is to sign up for probation today.
                   Ct 2: Dismissed.

15CM157  Ct 1: Sentence withheld for 24 months probation, concurrent. Conditions: Pay costs of action and costs of probation, Attend, pay for and successfully complete Domestic Abuse Program or Anger mgt  program or both at direction of agent , AODA assessment and follow through, with recommendations of counselor,  must submit to psychological assessment and follow through with recommendations of counselor, DNA sample and surcharge. Def is to sign up for probation today.
                    Ct 2, 3, 4 & 5: Dismissed

Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  At request of counsel, this matter adj. to tomorrow at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Defendant John R. Schweitzer. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Status given. Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant John R. Schweitzer in court with Atty Angel. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Waives formal reading of complaint.  Court informs defendant of maximum penalties. Defendant pleas NG  Status hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
